intro: Caucalis platycarpos var. muricata, commonly known as the rough-leaved caucalis, is a variant of the caucalis plant characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The varietal name "muricata" refers to the rough, bristly texture of its foliage, which distinguishes it from other forms of the species.
